thread.title: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger leaning towards exit after Bayern Munich loss | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger leaning towards exit after Bayern Munich loss | Metro News

author: Mark Brus For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger leaning towards exit after Bayern Munich loss | Metro News
text:
Arsene Wenger leaning towards Arsenal exit after 5-1 Bayern Munich defeat gossip Mark Brus for Metro.co.uk Thursday 16 Feb 2017 6:39 pm Arsene Wenger has been stalling on a new Arsenal contract (Picture: Getty) 
Arsene Wenger is reportedly leaning towards quitting Arsenal at the end of this season after seeing his side thrashed 5-1 by Bayern Munich in the Champions League. Rumour Mill: our round-up of football gossip, rumours and speculation 
The Gunners are almost certainly facing elimination from the competition after such a heavy defeat in Germany, with at least a 4-0 win required to send them through in the second leg at the Emirates Stadium. 
Arsenal are widely seen as having underachieved in the latter half of Wenger’s 20-year reign, and the Frenchman now seems ready to call it a day. Wenger may be coming towards the end of his long Arsenal reign (Picture: Getty) 
Sources at the club believe Wenger’s situation had been at 50-50 until last night’s humiliating result at the Allianz Arena, which is pushing him towards ending his time in north London, according to the Daily Mirror . 
Arsenal have been worried about the situation for some time, with Wenger stalling on the offer of a two-year contract extension for much of this season. 
Replacements are already being looked at, with Juventus’ Massimiliano Allegri a leading contender to take the big job. To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video Next Arsenal manager odds (Sky Bet) Massimiliano Allegri – 4/1
